On 2/14/07, Paul Downey <paul.downey@...> wrote:
>
> What worries me most about REST is that it isn't testable.
> What allows you to say this site is "powered by REST"
> beyond passing the sniff of a bunch of self-appointed
> critics on this list.
>
> In this respect it's really no better than SOA.

I am trying to tackle exactly this issue. I certainly agree that as a
general statement, REST isn't testable as it is an architectural style
... however ... I think that it is possible to make testable RESTful
patterns. There will be more than one pattern, to be sure, but each
pattern will be testable.

I am working on EARL test / assertion representations of my own
pattern and an engine to exercise EARL instances (hence the diagram I
showed the group last month). Having this would permit a web
application to claim a 'conformance level' to a specific pattern -
just as HTML can claim various WCAG conformance levels.

Alan Dean
http://thoughtpad.net/who/alan-dean/news
